title: The Future Of Phone Service
teaser: THE FUTURE OF PHONE SERVICE: American phone companies began laying the nation's vast copper wire telecom network in the 1800s. But today less than one-third of the country uses the old copper lines, and a mere 5 percent rely on them exclusively. The advent of fiber optic cable and wireless phone service makes the copper network obsolete. We explore the fate of landline phone service and concerns about pricing, safety and access as the nation transitions to an all-digital phone future. (52 min.)
